snippet: The buyback, which aims to trim about 20 billion euros, or nearly $26 billion, from Greece’s staggering 323 billion euro debt, could be announced early next week.
abstract: Greece's largest banks agree to sell their discounted bonds back to the government in a move that brings the nation one step closer to completing a complex debt-reduction deal; buyback aims to trim about 20 billion euros, or nearly $26 billion, from Greece's 323 billion euro debt.
lead_paragraph: The buyback, which aims to trim about 20 billion euros, or nearly $26 billion, from Greece’s staggering 323 billion euro debt, could be announced early next week.

headline.main: Banks Agree to Sell Back Some Greek Bonds
headline.print_headline: Banks Agree to Sell Back Some Greek Bonds
